intro: Anthemis arvensis subsp. cyllenea, commonly known as the field chamomile, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features erect, branched stems that are often hairy, and it produces small, yellowish-white flower heads arranged in clusters. The plant has finely divided, linear leaves that are aromatic and emit a strong, camphor-like scent. Its flowers are composite, consisting of ray florets and disc florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
